functions.name: and
functions.help: Perform boolean AND operation on two or more values.

functions.name: if
functions.help: Evaluate condition and switch to correct branch.

functions.name: unless
functions.help: Shorthand for `if(not(cond), then, else?)`

functions.name: not
functions.help: Perform boolean NOT operation.

functions.name: or
functions.help: Perform boolean OR operation on two or more values.

functions.name: try
functions.help: Attempt to evaluate given expression and return null if it raised an error.

functions.name: eq
functions.help: Test string or sequence equality.

functions.name: ne
functions.help: Test string or sequence inequality.

functions.name: gt
functions.help: Test string or sequence s1 > s2.

functions.name: ge
functions.help: Test string or sequence s1 >= s2.

functions.name: lt
functions.help: Test string or sequence s1 < s2.

functions.name: le
functions.help: Test string or sequence s1 <= s2.

functions.name: abs
functions.help: Return absolute value of number.

functions.name: add
functions.help: Add two or more numbers.

functions.name: argmax
functions.help: Return the index or label of the largest number in the list.

functions.name: argmin
functions.help: Return the index or label of the smallest number in the list.

functions.name: ceil
functions.help: Return the smallest integer greater than or equal to x.

functions.name: div
functions.help: Divide two or more numbers.

functions.name: idiv
functions.help: Integer division of two numbers.

functions.name: int
functions.help: Cast value as int and raise an error if impossible.

functions.name: float
functions.help: Cast value as float and raise an error if impossible.

functions.name: floor
functions.help: Return the smallest integer lower than or equal to x.

functions.name: log
functions.help: Return the natural or custom base logarithm of x.

functions.name: log2
functions.help: Return the base 2 logarithm of x.

functions.name: log10
functions.help: Return the base 10 logarithm of x.

functions.name: max
functions.help: Return the maximum number.

functions.name: min
functions.help: Return the minimum number.

functions.name: mod
functions.help: Return the remainder of x divided by y.

functions.name: mul
functions.help: Multiply two or more numbers.

functions.name: neg
functions.help: Return -x.

functions.name: pow
functions.help: Raise x to the power of y.

functions.name: round
functions.help: Return x rounded to the nearest integer.

functions.name: sqrt
functions.help: Return the square root of x.

functions.name: sub
functions.help: Subtract two or more numbers.

functions.name: trunc
functions.help: Truncate the number by removing its decimal part.

functions.name: bytesize
functions.help: Return a number of bytes in human-readable format (KB, MB, GB, etc.).

functions.name: escape_regex
functions.help: Escape a string so it can be used safely in a regular expression.

functions.name: fmt
functions.help:
Format a string by replacing "{}" occurrences by subsequent arguments.

Example: `fmt("Hello {} {}", name, surname)` will replace the first "{}" by the value of the name column, then the second one by the value of the surname column.

Can also be given a substitution map like so:
`fmt("Hello {name}", {name: "John"})`.

functions.name: lower
functions.help: Lowercase string.

functions.name: pad
functions.help: Pad given string with spaces or given character so that it is least given width.

functions.name: lpad
functions.help: Left pad given string with spaces or given character so that it is least given width.

functions.name: rpad
functions.help: Right pad given string with spaces or given character so that it is least given width.

functions.name: printf
functions.help: Apply printf formatting with given format and arguments.

functions.name: numfmt
functions.help: Format a number with thousands separator and proper significance.

functions.name: trim
functions.help: Trim string of leading & trailing whitespace or provided characters.

functions.name: ltrim
functions.help: Trim string of leading whitespace or provided characters.

functions.name: rtrim
functions.help: Trim string of trailing whitespace or provided characters.

functions.name: upper
functions.help: Uppercase string.

functions.name: count
functions.help: Count number of times substring appear in string. Or count the number of times a regex pattern matched the strings. Note that only non-overlapping matches will be counted in both cases.

functions.name: endswith
functions.help: Test if string ends with substring.

functions.name: match
functions.help: Return a regex pattern match on the string.

functions.name: replace
functions.help:
Replace all non-overlapping occurrences of substring in given string with provided replacement. Can also replace regex pattern matches.

See regex replacement string syntax documentation here:
https://docs.rs/regex/latest/regex/struct.Regex.html#replacement-string-syntax

functions.name: split
functions.help: Split a string by a given separator substring. Can also split using a regex pattern.

functions.name: startswith
functions.help: Test if string starts with substring.

functions.name: concat
functions.help: Concatenate given strings into a single one.

functions.name: contains
functions.help:
If target is a string: return whether substring can be found in it or return whether given regular expression matched.

If target is a list, returns whether given item was found in it.

If target is a map, returns whether given key was found in it.

functions.name: first
functions.help: Get first element of sequence.

functions.name: last
functions.help: Get last element of sequence.

functions.name: len
functions.help: Get length of sequence.

functions.name: get
functions.help: If target is a string, return the nth unicode char. If target is a list, return the nth item. Indices are zero-based and can be negative to access items in reverse. If target is a map, return the value associated with given key. All variants can also take a default value when desired item is not found.

functions.name: slice
functions.help: Return slice of sequence.

functions.name: compact
functions.help: Drop all falsey values from given list.

functions.name: filter
functions.help:
Return a list containing only elements for which given lambda returned true.
For instance: `filter(names, name => name.startswith('A'))`

functions.name: index_by
functions.help: Take a list of maps and a key name and return an indexed map from selected keys to the original maps.

functions.name: join
functions.help: Join sequence by separator.

functions.name: map
functions.help:
Return a list with elements transformed by given lambda.
For instance: `map(numbers, n => n + 3)`

functions.name: mean
functions.help: Return the mean of the given numbers.

functions.name: sum
functions.help: Return the sum of the given numbers, or nothing if the sum overflowed.

functions.name: keys
functions.help: Return a list of the map's keys.

functions.name: values
functions.help: Return a list of the map's values.

functions.name: datetime
functions.help:
Parse a string as a datetime according to format and timezone. If no format is provided, string is parsed as ISO 8601 date format. Default timezone is the system timezone.
https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/strtime/index.html#conversion-specifications

functions.name: strftime
functions.help: Format target (a time in ISO 8601 format, or the result of datetime() function) according to format.

functions.name: timestamp
functions.help: Parse a number as a POSIX timestamp in seconds (nb of seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC), and convert it to a datetime in local time.

functions.name: timestamp_ms
functions.help: Parse a number as a POSIX timestamp in milliseconds (nb of milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC), and convert it to a datetime in local time.

functions.name: to_timezone
functions.help: Parse target (a time in ISO 8601 format, or the result of datetime() function) in timezone_in, and convert it to timezone_out.

functions.name: to_local_timezone
functions.help: Parse target (a time in ISO 8601 format, or the result of datetime() function) in timezone_in, and convert it to the system's local timezone.

functions.name: year_month_day
functions.help:
Extract the year, month and day of a datetime. If the input is a string, first parse it into datetime, and then extract the year, month and day.
Equivalent to `strftime(string, format="%Y-%m-%d")`.

functions.name: month_day
functions.help:
Extract the month and day of a datetime. If the input is a string, first parse it into datetime, and then extract the month and day.
Equivalent to `strftime(string, format="%m-%d")`.

functions.name: month
functions.help:
Extract the month of a datetime. If the input is a string, first parse it into datetime, and then extract the month.
Equivalent to `strftime(string, format="%m")`.

functions.name: year
functions.help:
Extract the year of a datetime. If the input is a string, first parse it into datetime, and then extract the year.
Equivalent to `strftime(string, format="%Y")`.

functions.name: year_month
functions.help:
Extract the year and month of a datetime. If the input is a string, first parse it into datetime, and then extract the year and month.
Equivalent to `strftime(string, format="%Y-%m")`.

functions.name: html_unescape
functions.help: Unescape given HTML string by converting HTML entities back to normal text.

functions.name: lru
functions.help:
Convert the given URL to LRU format.
For more info, read this: https://github.com/medialab/ural#about-lrus

functions.name: mime_ext
functions.help: Return the extension related to given mime type.

functions.name: parse_dataurl
functions.help: Parse the given data url and return its mime type and decoded binary data.

functions.name: urljoin
functions.help: Join an url with the given addendum.

functions.name: fingerprint
functions.help: Fingerprint a string by normalizing characters, re-ordering and deduplicating its word tokens before re-joining them by spaces.

functions.name: carry_stemmer
functions.help: Apply the "Carry" stemmer targeting the French language.

functions.name: s_stemmer
functions.help: Apply a very simple stemmer removing common plural inflexions in some languages.

functions.name: unidecode
functions.help: Convert string to ascii as well as possible.

functions.name: col
functions.help: Return value of cell for given column, by name, by position or by name & nth, in case of duplicate header names.

functions.name: col?
functions.help: Return value of cell for given column, by name, by position or by name & nth, in case of duplicate header names. Allow selecting inexisting columns, in which case it will return null.

functions.name: col_index
functions.help: Return zero-based index of given column, by name, by position or by name & nth, in case of duplicate header names.

functions.name: col_index?
functions.help: Return zero-based index of given column, by name, by position or by name & nth, in case of duplicate header names. Allow selecting inexisting columns, in which case it will return null.

functions.name: cols
functions.help: Return list of cell values from the given colum by name or position to another given column by name or position, inclusive. Can also be called with a single argument to take a slice from the given column to the end, or no argument at all to take all columns.

functions.name: err
functions.help: Make the expression return a custom error.

functions.name: headers
functions.help: Return list of header names from the given colum by name or position to another given column by name or position, inclusive. Can also be called with a single argument to take a slice from the given column to the end, or no argument at all to return all headers.

functions.name: index
functions.help: Return the row's index, if applicable.

functions.name: regex
functions.help: Parse given string as regex. Useful when your patterns are dynamic, e.g. built from a CSV cell. Else prefer using regex literals e.g. "/test/".

functions.name: typeof
functions.help: Return type of value.

functions.name: abspath
functions.help: Return absolute & canonicalized path.

functions.name: copy
functions.help: Copy a source to target path. Will create necessary directories on the way. Returns target path as a convenience.

functions.name: ext
functions.help: Return the path's extension, if any.

functions.name: filesize
functions.help: Return the size of given file in bytes.

functions.name: isfile
functions.help: Return whether the given path is an existing file on disk.

functions.name: move
functions.help: Move a source to target path. Will create necessary directories on the way. Returns target path as a convenience.

functions.name: parse_json
functions.help: Parse the given string as JSON.

functions.name: pathjoin
functions.help: Join multiple paths correctly.

functions.name: read
functions.help: Read file at path. Default encoding is "utf-8". Default error handling policy is "replace", and can be one of "replace", "ignore" or "strict".

functions.name: read_csv
functions.help: Read and parse CSV file at path, returning its rows as a list of maps with headers as keys.

functions.name: read_json
functions.help: Read and parse JSON file at path.

functions.name: write
functions.help: Write string to path as utf-8 text. Will create necessary directories recursively before actually writing the file. Return the path that was written.

functions.name: md5
functions.help: Return the md5 hash of string in hexadecimal representation.

functions.name: random
functions.help: Return a random float between 0 and 1.

functions.name: uuid
functions.help: Return a uuid v4.
